1.content:
"Hurry up, you little insect!" Victoria called from the dining room where she and her two daughters sat at the dinner table impatiently. "We're hungry out here!" In the kitchen, Billy was rushing as fast as he could to finish the dinner his family had ordered him to prepare. He knew if he kept them waiting too long, it would mean another beating no meals for a week. The poor boy was already scrawny enough as it was! He placed his family's meals in front of them, not even expecting a thank you, and quickly scarfed down what little was left for himself before going to his bedroll in the attic and silently crying into his pillow.

Where shall the story go from here?

1. The next day, Billy sneaks out to visit Sarah, who is fed up with the way Billy's family treats him. She shares her secret identity as a werewolf with him, and devises a plan to teach them a lesson once and for all.

2. Victoria takes herself and her daughters on a day out, leaving Billy by himself to clean the house while they're away.

3. Victoria decides that she doesn't need Billy around anymore, and takes him out into the woods to abandon him.

4. When forced to do a seemingly impossible task, all seems hopeless for Billy. But then, a strange lady offers to help him, if he can guess her name.

5. While crying in the forrest, A strange spider appears beside Billy. It tells him that it is really a beautiful girl under a curse, and asks him to kiss her to break the spell.
1.title: Once Upon a Time...

info.brief_description: A modern fairytale of a boy with a wicked family, and his only friend, Sarah Wolfe.
info.description:
You probably guessed this already, but this story is based on and inspired by the collections of the Brother's Grimm. Not the ones we all grew up with, mind you. I mean to original versions. That's right, all the bloody gruesome goodness of old school cautionary tales, wrapped up into a single story. Here's the rundown...

Billy Grimm used to be a happy child, until the day his mother passed away. But that was just the beginning of his troubles. Soon afterwards, his father remarried a cruel, vile woman named Victoria who had two teenage daughters, Bella and Donna, who were just as mean and wicked. Billy's new stepmother and siblings treated him like a slave, in addition to regularly abusing him when his father wasn't around.

Then, one day, his father is killed in an accident on his way home from work. Now the only family he has is his terrible stepmother and sisters. The only bright spot in his life his friend, Sarah Wolfe. One day, Billy had snuck out of his home and into the woods to cry, when he looked up to see A pretty young girl standing over him. She asked why he was crying and comforted him, introducing herself as Sarah. Ever since, she's been sort of like a new Mother to him.

Will Billy's life ever improve? Will his evil family Get what they deserve? That's for the reader's to decide.
